member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession
member.summary: Drawing sessions are used to issue graphics drawing commands. This is the main way to draw things onto a canvas.

remarks.p: For best performance, graphics drawing commands need to be batched into groups so the GPU hardware can process as many operations as possible in parallel. Win2D achieves this through the CanvasDrawingSession API. A drawing session represents an active batch of commands that are in the process of being generated. Use CanvasDrawingSession's various methods to indicate what you want to draw, then when you are done close the CanvasDrawingSession. This will finalize the command batch, optimize it and submit it to the GPU hardware to be carried out. No actual rendering work is performed on the GPU until the CanvasDrawingSession is closed.

CanvasDrawingSession implements the IClosable interface; therefore, you close it by explicitly calling the Close method (which is projected into .NET as Dispose). If you are using C#, you can also use the 'using' statement. If you are using C++/CX, Close is accessed via the 'delete' keyword.

Drawing sessions can be obtained in various different ways. Most often, you should use the one that is passed in to the CanvasControl. or CanvasAnimatedControl. event handler. A drawing session obtained in this way is automatically closed after the event handler returns, so there is no need for you to do anything else. However, if you explicitly created a drawing session you must close it yourself when you are done drawing to it.
When using Direct2D interop, this Win2D class corresponds to the Direct2D interface ID2D1DeviceContext1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Clear(Windows.UI.Color)
member.summary: Clears to the specified color.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Clear(System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Clears to the specified high-dynamic-range color.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Flush
member.summary: Sends any pending drawing commands to the graphics device.

remarks.p: In normal usage it is not necessary to call Flush, since the Flush happens automatically when you close the drawing session.

There's a cost associated with each command submitted to the graphics device, so the drawing session groups together multiple drawing operations into batches. When the drawing session is closed the last batch is sent to the device. This method can be used to force all pending commands to be sent to the device without closing the session.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawImage(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasImage)
member.summary: Draws an image.

ul.li: The image is drawn at the origin (0,0).
This overload is not valid when is set to .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawImage(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasImage,System.Numerics.Vector2)
member.summary: Draws an image.

ul.li: The image is drawn at the specified offset.
This overload is not valid when is set to .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawImage(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasImage,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Draws an image.

ul.li: The image is drawn at the specified offset.
This overload is not valid when is set to .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawImage(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBitmap,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Draws a bitmap.

ul.li: The bitmap is scaled to fill the specified destination rectangle.
This overload only accepts bitmaps since non-bitmap images (command lists or effects) need a source rectangle to be specified as they may be have infinite size.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawImage(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasImage,System.Numerics.Vector2,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Draws an image.

ul.li: The image is drawn at the specified offset.
The source rectangle specifies, in the image's coordinate system, the area within the image that will be drawn.
This overload is not valid when is set to .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawImage(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasImage,System.Single,System.Single,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Draws an image.

ul.li: The image is drawn at the specified offset.
The source rectangle specifies, in the image's coordinate system, the area within the image that will be drawn.
This overload is not valid when is set to .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawImage(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasImage,Windows.Foundation.Rect,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Draws an image.

ul.li: The area of the image specified by the source rectangle is scaled to fill the destination rectangle.
The source rectangle is specified in the image's coordinate system
If the source image is a bitmap then the source rectangle is clipped to the bounds of the bitmap.
This overload is not valid when is set to .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawImage(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasImage,System.Numerics.Vector2,Windows.Foundation.Rect,System.Single)
member.summary: Draws an image.

ul.li: The image is drawn at the specified offset.
The source rectangle specifies, in the image's coordinate system, the area within the image that will be drawn.
The opacity parameter is a float between 0.0f and 1.0f. 1.0f is the default.
This overload is not valid when is set to .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawImage(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasImage,System.Single,System.Single,Windows.Foundation.Rect,System.Single)

member.summary: Draws an image.

The source rectangle specifies, in the image's coordinate system, the area within the image that will be drawn.
The opacity parameter is a float between 0.0f and 1.0f. 1.0f is the default.
The interpolation parameter defaults to .
The composite mode parameters defaults to .
Because the composite mode is explicitly specified, this overload ignores the current setting.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.FillRectangle(Windows.Foundation.Rect,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.ICanvasBrush,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.ICanvasBrush)
member.summary: Fills the interior of a rectangle, using a brush to define the color and a second brush to specify an opacity mask.

remarks.p: Transparent portions of the opacity mask brush indicate the areas where the contents of the rectangle will be transparent, while opaque portions of the mask indicate where the rectangle is visible. The RGB color of the opacity mask is ignored.

For more flexible opacity mask options, see the
and .
Optimization note - this method is fastest when all the following requirements are satisfied:

ul.li: The opacity brush is a
Opacity brush is a or
Opacity brush contains only positive scaling and translation (no rotation or other transforms), and is positioned so the rectangle being drawn will not extend past the edge of the opacity bitmap
Opacity brush is set to 1.0 (the default)
Opacity brush is (the default)
The drawing session property is set to (not its default!)

remarks.p: The opacity mask brush is allowed to be null.

member.summary: Fills the interior of a rectangle, using a brush to define the color and a second brush to specify an opacity mask.

remarks.p: Transparent portions of the opacity mask brush indicate the areas where the contents of the rectangle will be transparent, while opaque portions of the mask indicate where the rectangle is visible. The RGB color of the opacity mask is ignored.

For more flexible opacity mask options, see the
and .
Optimization note - this method is fastest when all the following requirements are satisfied:

Opacity brush is set to 1.0 (the default)

The drawing session property is set to (not its default!)

remarks.p: The opacity mask brush is allowed to be null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the CanvasDrawingSession.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Units
member.summary: Sets what units are used to specifiy coordinates for this drawing session.
member.remarks: For more information, see DPI and DIPs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Transform
member.summary: Sets the transform matrix that will be applied to subsequent drawing calls on this drawing session.

remarks.p: Transform may be changed multiple times in a single drawing session.
The example below demonstrates what happens when Transform is assigned different values within a single drawing session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.TextAntialiasing
member.summary: Sets the text antialiasing mode for this drawing session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Blend
member.summary: Sets the blend mode for this drawing session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Antialiasing
member.summary: Enables or disables primitive edge antialiasing for this drawing session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.EffectTileSize
member.summary: Specifies the tile size used when drawing image effects.

remarks.p: For advanced scenarios, this property allows the application to tune the performance and resource usage of effect drawing operations.

Large image effects are drawn by splitting them up into a number of smaller tiles, which are sent separately to the GPU. This reduces intermediate memory usage, and allows processing very large images (potentially larger than , which can be necessary for instance during printing).
The default tile size is 1024x1024.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.EffectBufferPrecision
member.summary: Specifies the default precision used for intermediate buffers when drawing image effects.

remarks.p: If not null, this property specifies what intermediate buffer precision to use when drawing effect graphs that do not explicitly specify a precision on the effect itself.
If null, and the effect does not specify its own precision, the intermediate buffer precision will be the maximum precision of the inputs to the effect.
If the effect specifies its own precision, this property is ignored.
For more information, see Effect precision and clamping.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Device
member.summary: Gets the underlying device used by this drawing session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.Dpi
member.summary: Gets the dots-per-inch (DPI) of this drawing session.

remarks.p: DPI describes the ratio between device independent pixels (DIPs) and actual physical pixels. The identity DPI value is 96, which means DIPs and pixels are the same.
Drawing sessions inherit their DPI from the , or they were created from.
For more information, see DPI and DIPs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.ConvertPixelsToDips(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts units from physical pixels to device independent pixels (DIPs) based on the DPI of this drawing session.
member.remarks: For more information, see DPI and DIPs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.ConvertDipsToPixels(System.Single,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDpiRounding)
member.summary: Converts units from device independent pixels (DIPs) to physical pixels based on the DPI of this drawing session.
member.remarks: For more information, see DPI and DIPs.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite
member.summary: The composite mode used for the effect.

remarks.p: The equations listed in enum descriptions use these elements: O = Output S = Source SA = Source Alpha D = Destination DA = Destination Alpha

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.SourceOver
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps. Equation: O = S + (1 - SA) * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.DestinationOver
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps. Equation: O = (1 - DA) * S + D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.SourceIn
member.summary: Intersection of source and destination bitmaps. Equation: O = DA * S.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.DestinationIn
member.summary: Intersection of source and destination bitmaps. Equation: O = SA * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.SourceOut
member.summary: Region of the source bitmap. Equation: O = (1 - DA) * S.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.DestinationOut
member.summary: Region of the destination bitmap. Equation: O = (1 - SA) * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.SourceAtop
member.summary: Region of the destination bitmap. Equation: O = DA * S + (1 - SA) * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.DestinationAtop
member.summary: Region of the source bitmap. Equation: O = (1 - DA) * S + SA * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.Xor
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps with xor function for pixels that overlap. Equation: O = (1 - DA) * S + (1 - SA) * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.Add
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps. Equation: O = S + D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.Copy
member.summary: Region of the source bitmap. Equation: O = S.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.BoundedCopy
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps with no destination override. Equation: O = S (only where source exists).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.MaskInvert
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps with unchanged alpha. Equation: O = (1 - D) * S + (1 - SA) * D.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.FillGeometry(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasGeometry,System.Numerics.Vector2,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.ICanvasBrush,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.ICanvasBrush)
member.summary: Fills a geometry relative to the specified position, using a brush to define the color and a second brush to specify an opacity mask.

remarks.p: Transparent portions of the opacity mask brush indicate the areas where the contents of the geometry will be transparent, while opaque portions of the mask indicate where the geometry is visible. The RGB color of the opacity mask is ignored.

For more flexible opacity mask options, see the
and .
Optimization note - this method is fastest when all the following requirements are satisfied:

ul.li: The main color brush (not necessarily the opacity brush, which can be any type of brush) is a
Its is a or
Its and properties are set to (the default)

remarks.p: The opacity mask brush is allowed to be null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.FillGeometry(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasGeometry,System.Single,System.Single,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.ICanvasBrush,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.ICanvasBrush)
member.summary: Fills a geometry relative to the specified position, using a brush to define the color and a second brush to specify an opacity mask.

remarks.p: Transparent portions of the opacity mask brush indicate the areas where the contents of the geometry will be transparent, while opaque portions of the mask indicate where the geometry is visible. The RGB color of the opacity mask is ignored.

For more flexible opacity mask options, see the
and .
Optimization note - this method is fastest when all the following requirements are satisfied:

ul.li: The main color brush (not necessarily the opacity brush, which can be any type of brush) is a
Its is a or
Its and properties are set to (the default)

remarks.p: The opacity mask brush is allowed to be null.

remarks.p: Transparent portions of the opacity mask brush indicate the areas where the contents of the geometry will be transparent, while opaque portions of the mask indicate where the geometry is visible. The RGB color of the opacity mask is ignored.

For more flexible opacity mask options, see the
and .
Optimization note - this method is fastest when all the following requirements are satisfied:

ul.li: The main color brush (not necessarily the opacity brush, which can be any type of brush) is a
Its is a or
Its and properties are set to (the default)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.CreateLayer(System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a layer that will blend its contents using the specified opacity.

remarks.p: The layer affects all drawing until the returned object is closed. In C# this is typically done with a 'using' statement, or in C++/CX the 'delete' keyword.
For more information about layers, see .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.CreateLayer(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.ICanvasBrush)
member.summary: Creates a layer that will blend its contents using the specified opacity mask brush (which could contain a bitmap or gradient).

remarks.p: The layer affects all drawing until the returned object is closed. In C# this is typically done with a 'using' statement, or in C++/CX the 'delete' keyword.
For more information about layers, see .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.CreateLayer(System.Single,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Creates a layer that will clip its contents to a rectangle, and blend using the specified opacity.

remarks.p: The layer affects all drawing until the returned object is closed. In C# this is typically done with a 'using' statement, or in C++/CX the 'delete' keyword.
For more information about layers, see .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.CreateLayer(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.ICanvasBrush,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Creates a layer that will clip its contents to a rectangle, and blend using the specified opacity mask brush.

remarks.p: The layer affects all drawing until the returned object is closed. In C# this is typically done with a 'using' statement, or in C++/CX the 'delete' keyword.
For more information about layers, see .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.CreateLayer(System.Single,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasGeometry)
member.summary: Creates a layer that will clip its contents to an arbitrarily complex region defined by a geometry, and blend using the specified opacity.

remarks.p: The layer affects all drawing until the returned object is closed. In C# this is typically done with a 'using' statement, or in C++/CX the 'delete' keyword.
Antialising mode of the clip geometry is determined by the value of the property when CreateLayer is called.
For more information about layers, see .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.CreateLayer(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.ICanvasBrush,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasGeometry)
member.summary: Creates a layer that will clip its contents to an arbitrarily complex region defined by a geometry, and blend using the specified opacity mask brush.

remarks.p: The layer affects all drawing until the returned object is closed. In C# this is typically done with a 'using' statement, or in C++/CX the 'delete' keyword.
Antialising mode of the clip geometry is determined by the value of the property when CreateLayer is called.
For more information about layers, see .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.CreateLayer(System.Single,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasGeometry,System.Numerics.Matrix3x2)
member.summary: Creates a layer that will clip its contents to an arbitrarily complex region defined by a geometry, and blend using the specified opacity.

remarks.p: The layer affects all drawing until the returned object is closed. In C# this is typically done with a 'using' statement, or in C++/CX the 'delete' keyword.
Antialising mode of the clip geometry is determined by the value of the property when CreateLayer is called.
For more information about layers, see .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.CreateLayer(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.ICanvasBrush,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasGeometry,System.Numerics.Matrix3x2)
member.summary: Creates a layer that will clip its contents to an arbitrarily complex region defined by a geometry, and blend the specified opacity mask brush.

remarks.p: The layer affects all drawing until the returned object is closed. In C# this is typically done with a 'using' statement, or in C++/CX the 'delete' keyword.
Antialising mode of the clip geometry is determined by the value of the property when CreateLayer is called.
For more information about layers, see .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.CreateLayer(System.Single,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.ICanvasBrush,Windows.Foundation.Rect,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasGeometry,System.Numerics.Matrix3x2,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasLayerOptions)
member.summary: Creates a layer that will clip its contents to a rectangle and/or geometry region, and blend using the specified opacity and/or opacity mask brush.

remarks.p: The layer affects all drawing until the returned object is closed. In C# this is typically done with a 'using' statement, or in C++/CX the 'delete' keyword.
Antialising mode of the clip geometry is determined by the value of the property when CreateLayer is called.
For more information about layers, see .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawInk(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkStroke})
member.summary: Draws a collection of ink strokes.

remarks.p: This overload reads the high-contrast accessiblity option from the system environment.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawInk(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkStroke},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draws a collection of ink strokes.

remarks.p: This overload allows an app to use an arbitrary high-contrast accessibility option, which may be different from the one globally specified in the system environment.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawGradientMesh(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasGradientMesh)
member.summary: Draws a gradient mesh, relative to the origin.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawGradientMesh(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasGradientMesh,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Draws a gradient mesh, relative to the specified position.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawGradientMesh(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasGradientMesh,System.Numerics.Vector2)
member.summary: Draws a gradient mesh, relative to the specified position.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.TextRenderingParameters
member.summary: Describes advanced options which are applied when text is being drawn.

remarks.p: Null is a valid value for this property, and it's the default. A null value means that the default behavior is chosen for text rendering based on the system environment.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawGlyphRun(System.Numerics.Vector2,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace,System.Single,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasGlyph[],System.Boolean,System.UInt32,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.ICanvasBrush)
member.summary: Draws a sequence of text characters which share the same formatting.

remarks.p:
The typical way to use this method is from the
method, in an application's implementation of , rather than to call it standalone. In particular, an application may want to adjust the properties of a glyph run, such as its positioning or font, before passing it on to be drawn by a CanvasDrawingSession.

This method's position parameter is different from the position used with . For DrawToTextRenderer, the position represents the top left corner of the layout box. For this method, the position is the baseline origin. For typical rendering with Latin scripts, the baseline is going to fall below the top left corner of the layout box.
This will use a default measuring mode of .

remarks.p:
The typical way to use this method is from the
method, in an application's implementation of , rather than to call it standalone. In particular, an application may want to adjust the properties of a glyph run, such as its positioning or font, before passing it on to be drawn by a CanvasDrawingSession.

This method's position parameter is different from the position used with . For DrawToTextRenderer, the position represents the top left corner of the layout box. For this method, the position is the baseline origin. For typical rendering with Latin scripts, the baseline is going to fall below the top left corner of the layout box.
It's valid to specify null for the clusterMapIndices."/>.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.CreateSpriteBatch
member.summary: Creates a new sprite batch for efficiently drawing many CanvasBitmaps.

remarks.p: See for details.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.CreateSpriteBatch(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasSpriteSortMode)
member.summary: Creates a new sprite batch for efficiently drawing many CanvasBitmaps with a specific sort mode.

remarks.p: The default sortMode is .
See for details.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.CreateSpriteBatch(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasSpriteSortMode,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasImageInterpolation)
member.summary: Creates a new sprite batch for efficiently drawing many CanvasBitmaps with a specific sort mode and interpolation.

remarks.p: The default sortMode is .
The default interpolation is . The only other valid interpolation option is . Any other values will result in the call failing.
See for details.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.CreateSpriteBatch(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasSpriteSortMode,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasImageInterpolation,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasSpriteOptions)
member.summary: Creates a new sprite batch for efficiently drawing many CanvasBitmaps with a specific sort mode, interpolation and options.

remarks.p: The default sortMode is .
The default interpolation is . The only other valid interpolation option is . Any other values will result in the call failing.
The default value for options is .
See for details.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawSvg(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Svg.CanvasSvgDocument,Windows.Foundation.Size,System.Numerics.Vector2)
member.summary: Draws an SVG document with the specified viewport size, at the specified coordinate location.

remarks.p: The viewport size is in device-independent units. Its width and height must be positive and nonzero. The viewport is separate from the SVG <viewbox> element; a viewbox is within a viewport.
The specified coordinates are in device-independent units.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawSvg(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Svg.CanvasSvgDocument,Windows.Foundation.Size,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Draws an SVG document with the specified viewport size, at the specified coordinates.

remarks.p: The viewport size is in device-independent units. Its width and height must be positive and nonzero. The viewport is separate from the SVG <viewbox> element; a viewbox is within a viewport.
The specified coordinates are in device-independent units.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDrawingSession.DrawSvg(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Svg.CanvasSvgDocument,Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Draws an SVG document with the specified viewport size at the origin.

remarks.p: The viewport size is in device-independent units. Its width and height must be positive and nonzero. The viewport is separate from the SVG <viewbox> element; a viewbox is within a viewport.
